BakeryQuestions.MaterialsUsed: olive oil, salt, asiago cheese, pint containers

VendorApplication.Description: Fickle Creek is a 145-acre Orange County farm that includes production areas (pastures, market garden), managed woodlots, and natural areas. We manage our farm so that it has minimum impact on the environment, is sustainable, and includes humane treatment of our animals. All fruits and vegetables are naturally grown without inorganic chemical inputs. Eggs, chicken, and duck come from flocks that range freely on pesticide-free pastures, eat locally-sourced vegetarian feed, and never receive hormones or antibiotics. Steers, pigs, and sheep are raised on pasture without medicated feed, hormones, or grain finishing. We sell all our products locally and directly to customers who we encourage to ask us questions about our practices.
VendorApplication.Name: Fickle Creek Farm

ProduceQuestions.PestControl: organic mulches, hand weeding, crop rotation, trap crops, inter-cropping, chickens, sheep, pigs

ProteinQuestions.AnimalBreeds: broiler chickens - freedom rangers, cornish cross.cows - jersey, holstein, senepol x angus.laying hens - araucana, barred plymouth rock, clack sex-link, delaware, golden comet, red star, speckled sussex, white leghorn.pigs - farmers' hybrid.sheep - katahdin, dorper.
ProteinQuestions.AnimalShelter: broilers - only warm season and provided canopies in pasture and under trees.cows - trees, pole barn and calf huts as needed.ducks - trees and laying/brooding sheds.laying hens - trees and eggmobiles for roosting.pigs - open-ended qoanset huts.sheep - trees, pole barn and lamb mini-quanset huts as needed.
ProteinQuestions.DiseasesAndParasites: No prophylactic medications used.Rapid rotations to fresh pastures to control endo-parasites, access to dust baths for chickens and wallows for pigs to control ecto-parasites.Occassional use of apple cider vinegar in chickens to control coccidia.Occassional dewormer used on sheep on a case-by-case basis using the FAMACHA system (= ocular membrane observation), and aggresive culling of sheep susceptible to internal parasites.
ProteinQuestions.FeedingPractices: all - free-range, on pasture, without confinement, and rapid rotation.broilers - range feeders in pasture, free choice of locally milled custom blend feed.cows - rapid rotational grazing on pastures, hay in winter, mineral supplements.ducks - range feeders in pasture, free choice of locally milled custom blend feed, oyster shell supplement.laying hens - range feeders in pasture, free choice of locally milled custom blend feed, oyster shell supplement.pigs - free choice of locally milled feed.sheep - rapid rotational grazing on pastures, hay in winter, mineral supplements.
ProteinQuestions.Processor: Acre Station Meat Farm, Chaudhry Halal Meat, Matkins Meats
